title: 111_hr2891
content: The "Access to Frontline Health Care Act of 2009" includes a Frontline Providers Loan Repayment Program under the Public Health Service Act. The Secretary will establish a Frontline Providers Loan Repayment Program where individuals agree to serve as health professionals for at least 2 years in a care scarcity area in exchange for student loan repayments. To be eligible, individuals must submit an application and sign a contract specified by the Secretary. The Loan Repayment Program requires individuals to sign a written contract specified by the Secretary for approval. Participants are accepted upon approval of their application and contract submission. Preference is given to those with interdisciplinary training. The Secretary will determine frontline care scarcity areas for recruitment. The Secretary determines frontline care scarcity areas for recruitment in interdisciplinary programs, giving preference to areas with demonstrated or planned interdisciplinary health care approaches. Written notice is provided upon approval for participation in the Loan Repayment Program. The Loan Repayment Program involves a written contract between the Secretary and an individual for student loan repayment in exchange for providing frontline care services for a minimum of 2 years at a healthcare facility. The Loan Repayment Program requires a 2-year full-time service commitment at a healthcare facility in a frontline care scarcity area. The contract includes provisions for financial obligations, damages for breach, and other relevant statements determined by the Secretary. The Loan Repayment Program entails a 2-year service commitment at a healthcare facility in a care scarcity area. The Secretary determines the amount for annual student loan repayment, considering the need to recruit healthcare providers. The Secretary may directly pay the loan provider on behalf of the individual. Breach of contract results from failing to start service. If an individual breaches a written contract by failing to start or complete their service obligation in a frontline care scarcity area, the United States can recover the total amount paid to the individual plus interest. A frontline care scarcity area is defined as a designated health professional shortage area or a location with a shortage of frontline care services. The term 'frontline care services' refers to health care services in various fields provided by specific healthcare professionals in areas designated by the State as having a shortage of such services. Authorized appropriations for carrying out frontline care services include funding amounts of $78,000,000 for fiscal year 2010, $93,000,000 for fiscal year 2011, $108,000,000 for fiscal year 2012, $123,000,000 for fiscal year 2013, $138,000,000 for fiscal year 2014, and $153,000,000 for fiscal year 2015. Eligible healthcare professionals must have completed a relevant course of study from an accredited institution in the United States. For fiscal years 2013 to 2015, authorized appropriations for frontline care services were $123,000,000, $138,000,000, and $153,000,000 respectively. Starting from fiscal year 2016, the amount appropriated would be adjusted annually based on the average percentage increase in health professions education costs. The Secretary is required to implement the loan repayment program within 180 days of the enactment of this section.
